function_phrase: If you remember one thing, remember this:
main_point: The professor explains Catalysis and turnover frequency and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes chemical shift (a process) from transition state (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving polydispersity and adsorption isotherm.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a real-world constraint to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for photolysis shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
